body:
When used in `ifort` mode, the compiler wrapper `cc` drops command line arguments that it should be passing through.  Included are the `-c source_file.f -o object_file.o` parts of the command line.  This causes the underlying `ifort` compiler to fail with:

```
ifort: command line warning #10159: invalid argument for option '-fp-model'
ifort: command line error: no files specified; for help type "ifort -help"
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

2. Run the compiler wrapper individually with the command:

   ```
   /usr/local/pkg/compiler/ifort/2018.5.274-GCC-5.4.0-2.26/compilers_and_libraries_2018.5.274/linux/bin/intel64/ifort -FI -fPIC
   -fp-model strict -O1 -qopenmp 
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/py-numpy-1.18.2-l6y6dtwjzwnepy7ryyvzr2zpec27od2y/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/core/include
   -c -c scipy/integrate/quadpack/dqwgtc.f
   -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.7/scipy/integrate/quadpack/dqwgtc.o
   ```

   This produces the resulting full command:
   ```
   /usr/local/pkg/compiler/ifort/2018.5.274-GCC-5.4.0-2.26/compilers_and_libraries_2018.5.274/linux/bin/intel64/ifort
   -march=broadwell -mtune=broadwell
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/libiconv-1.16-2aa2i6jwecq2dp2xcie2rjsk2i2zolkk/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/openssl-1.1.1f-v3gn2mrzsnnveeongbi44d5mc77l7gkz/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/libffi-3.2.1-2py4zqbhv3pcippljxximvn2iwcr7uwg/lib/libffi-3.2.1/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/ncurses-6.2-t7fweu3ebzmr5q3daoe4k3dhtf3gce72/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/libbsd-0.10.0-ibspdrgtwudhfmog6x7sy66asibndy3a/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/sqlite-3.30.1-f3p5ao73sahubjqzhclumrtpd6v7uzhr/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/expat-2.2.9-z3przplsxvxykvp4ktciosgs7mdgw55y/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/gettext-0.20.1-io5m5dzfhysfkci3t4b342z73fr6llkz/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/gdbm-1.18.1-waora6lsnisyuvj3iceea72r52jtrqjc/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/readline-8.0-ra5cyysdrkl5ir47lwpw4qpde2kp5w4u/include
   -I/usr/local/pkg/compiler/icc/2018.5.274-GCC-5.4.0-2.26/compilers_and_libraries_2018.5.274/linux/mkl/include -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/xz-5.2.5-ecd654sd4hwi3vani2mgtrk57ibmzila/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/python-3.7.6-fojsqcyhxvkd6veuigd3wedlm2zm62eg/include/python3.7m -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/bzip2-1.0.8-ykm24g5mlr7nfofzu7qi6g42e772flh6/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/zlib-1.2.11-h4mulpznj2xrtflosgpousid4nrsfxte/include
   -I/import/unsupported/TWOWAY/spack-uaf/opt/spack/linux-centos6-broadwell/intel-18.5.274/libxml2-2.9.9-ovzkloub3iyjoejlu3i3odfm2rov6uiz/include/libxml2
   -FI -fPIC -fp-model strict -O1 -qopenmp
   ```

Note that everything past `-qopenmp` is missing.

I produced this "in the field", in the middle of a large environment while building `py-scipy`, by adding the following to the end of the wrapper and looking at `spack-build-out.txt`:


```
echo "XX1: INPUT_COMMAND [$mode] $command $input_command"
echo "XX2: FULL_COMMAND [$mode] ${full_command[*]}"

exec "${full_command[@]}"
```

### Information on your system

Intel compiler `ifort`.

### Additional information

- [ ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
title: Compiler Wrappers Drop Command Line Arguments
